bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 37 (Thursday, February 29, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. CARAVEO:H.R. 7486.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Constitutional Authority--Necessary and Proper Clause (Art.I, Sec. 8, Clause 18)THE U.S. CONSTITUTIONARTICLE I, SECTION 8: POWERS OF CONGRESSCLAUSE 18The single subject of this legislation is:To authorize additional funds for the Shelter and ServicesProgram of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, and forother purposes.[Page H773]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: HELP for Interior Cities Act

item.title: Humanitarian Emergency Localized Partnerships for Interior Cities Act
To authorize additional funds for the Shelter and Services Program of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
